Posts.Content: aaronali12 wrote: I am getting ready to have my port put in on friday...I am very nervous.....They said I need it because I don't have good veins....I am just nervous I have to have surgery again and I am scared of actually having the port..I am getting 4 treatments of chemo 1x every 3 weeks. Does anyone have info on how safe the port is and is it dangerous? Do most people get the port and how is the surgery? will I need heavy anesthesia....just scared and confused....god bless Dx 3/23/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2010 12:06PM aaronali12 wrote: thank you for such a quick response. I am hoping I have the same outcome as you. I can't stop worrying. I just can't understand with all the treatment I could have cancer again and I am also on tamoxifen. I think I am getting alot of nose bleeds with that medicine. I can't figure out how something could come back so fast if I was taking meds to kill it. thank you god bless you! alison
Posts.Title: waiting for results again aaronali12 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: aaronali12 wrote: Hi everyone I havent been here in a while but I am back again. Here is my story. march23rd 2009 I was diagnosed with idc and dcis. I had a lumpectomy on april 30th 2009 and 3 lymph nodes removed which were clean. I than started chemo in july and had 4 rounds of taxotere and cytoxan. I finished in august. I than proceeded to have radiation for 6 weeks starting in october. So now a year has passed I had a petscan which came out fine. I just went for my for my first mammography since I finished treatment and a sonogram and I get a call that they need to do a bilateral contrast mri. I feel like I am having de ja vu. I had the mri last thursday and now I am waiting for the results. Has anyone been throught this same type of routine? I am so scared that the cancer has come back. Is that possible? I read some of tyhe report and it said they found something outside of the scar tissue. which is scaring me to death any advice or anything I would appreciate. I have to wait until tuesday for the results I am going crazy. I can't function. thank you and god bless. Dx 3/23/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: waiting for results again aaronali12 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: aaronali12 wrote: I just had my lumpectomy on april 30th and got back clean  margins and they removed 4 nodes. they were clean. I went to see two different oncologists. The first one wanted to do a test on my tumor and see what grade it is and than decide if I need chemo. I definitely need radiation and I have to go on tamoxifen which I am not happy about. does anyone have info on tamoxifen???anyway I went to another oncologist and he wants to do 4 rounds of chemo 1 time  every 3 weeks. I also have to get a port. He said the reason for chemo is to lower my reoccurrence rate. I just wanted to know if anyone had a lumpectomy with clean nodes and had chemo. I am really scared of the chemo. I would love any advice. Thank you and god bless Dx 3/23/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: why do I need chemo after lumpectomy with clean nodes aaronali12 jotti

Posts.Content: aaronali12 wrote: I recently got my biopsy results and they were invasive ductal carcinoma grade 1 also it said ductal carcinoma in situ..I am a little confused but I have been asking alot of questions.....my surgeon gave me a choice of a mastectomy or a lumpectomy....I would like to have a lumpectomy but I am also waiting for the gene test results to come back...anyone have any info on this  type of cancer? My surgeon said I will need 5 weeks of radiation and aggressive chemo......that sounds scary..I have been talking to the american cancer society and they give so much information. They are wonderful. I am hoping I dont carry the gene and I am praying it didnt go into my lymphnodes. While I am in surgery they will test my sentinel nodes. I should have the surgery by the end of the month. I am so scared? any advice....god bless and thank you alison a very scared 33 year old who is raising a little boy. Dx 3/23/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: just diagnosed at the age of 33 aaronali12 nandy1975

Posts.Content: aaronali12 wrote: I am going for my lumpectomy on april 30th with sentinel node testing......I have been diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma grade 1 and dcis........I keep thinking this cancer has taken over my whole body. I am 33 years old with a 2 1/2 year old son..I keep thinking the worst....I am trying to be positive but I am just so scared........I will be having aggressive chemo and radiation following my surgery..I am so scared of surgery..I never had general anesthesia....anyone have some good words of adviceor just a similar story?????I keep hearinf from everyone that I will be fine but how do they know...I am scared what stage I am in and I wont get the results till after my surgery....I keep thinking that I will wake up and this will all be gone.......I look at my son and I cry.......I just cant believe how supportive you guys are on this site....sometimes strangers are nicer than people you know......any support or anything please reply...gos bless and thank you Dx 3/23/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Going for surgery april 30th...terrified aaronali12 aaronali12

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2009 07:40AM aaronali12 wrote: Hi candy...dcis is ductal carcinoma in situ which means that it has not spread from its original area. which is good news...the invasive means that it has gone beyond its start point....I don't know what focal vascular invasion is. were you given a choice to have lumpectomy or mastectomy? I know this is very scary but stay strong!!!!!I am trying my best but as the days get closer to my surgery I am starting to panic....I just want to stay strong because I have a 2 1/2 year old....If you need to talk write to me anytime..after my surgery I will have more anwsers and I could pass the experience on to you......just stay strong and pray!!!!god bless and good luck....feel free to write me anytime....
Posts.Title: Going for surgery april 30th...terrified aaronali12 aaronali12

Posts.Content: May 3, 2009 08:27AM aaronali12 wrote: hi candy- my lumpectomy went very well.....They also did the seninel node biopsy and removed 4nodes..the preliminary said they were clean..I have to wait till wednesday or thursday for my path report. I feel great . I have a little numbness under my arm. I have been taking extra strength tylenol and that has been helping. I really wish you luck!!!I will make a prayer for you!!!what day is your surgery? please keep me updated and try to think positive and know that you will be fine and make it through......god bless thank you alison

Posts.Title: starting taxotere and cytoxan 4 rounds any info? aaronali12 xpectmiracles

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2009 09:19AM aaronali12 wrote: Hi I had my first taxotere and cytoxan on june 18th. I started to lose my hair july 1st..I had pretty long hair so I chopped it short and next I am going to shave it. It was very difficult for me to see my hair come out in chunks...I have to keep in my mind that this is temporary and hair grows back. I just got very emotional. I am now just waiting to get a wig from the american cancer society and hopefully my little bit of hair will hang in for a few more days. I have my next treatment on july 9 th. I had like a delayed reaction to the drugs I didnt get sick until this week. I felt a little tired for 2 days but that was it. Just stay strong and remember the hair will grow back but lets kill the cancer. god bless
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in July 2009 PauldingMom jacee
